guidelines:
Kit Components


• Capture Antibody Coated Plate* - 1 plate
• a-Synuclein Standard - (1) 25μg vial
• 5X Wash Buffer - 250mL
• 2X Reagent Diluent - 32mL
• Biotinylated Primary Antibody - 25μL
• Streptavidin-HRP - 25μL
• Chemiluminescent Substrate A - 6mL
• Chemiluminescent Substrate B - 6mL
• Plate Sealer - 3

 

* The strips in this plate are not readily removable; it is intended to be used as a whole plate. Attempting to remove the strips will result in damage for which Biolegend is not responsible.

 

Storage: Store kit at 2-8oC. We suggest storing the a-Synuclein Standard component only at ≤-70oC if you do not intend to use the kit within 2 weeks of receipt.

components.data:
Notes: Allow kit components to be brought to room temperature before use.

 

Label a 1L bottle as “1X Wash Buffer”.
components.name: Description

source_data.description:
Notes: Allow kit components to be brought to room temperature before use.

 

Label a 1L bottle as “1X Wash Buffer”.

components.data: Preparation of 1X Wash Buffer
components.name: Section

components.data:
Dilute 5X Wash Buffer 1:5 using lab grade water* and mix well.

 

*Note: Lab grade filtered water such as injection grade, cell culture grade, Reverse Osmosis De-Ionization
(RODI).
components.name: Description

source_data.description:
Dilute 5X Wash Buffer 1:5 using lab grade water* and mix well.

 

*Note: Lab grade filtered water such as injection grade, cell culture grade, Reverse Osmosis De-Ionization
(RODI).

components.data: Preparation of 1X Wash Buffer
components.name: Section

components.data: Label an appropriate sized bottle as “1X Reagent Diluent”.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Label an appropriate sized bottle as “1X Reagent Diluent”.

components.data: Preparation of 1X Reagent Diluent
components.name: Section

components.data:
Dilute 2X Reagent Diluent to 1X by adding 30mL of 2X Reagent Diluent to 30mL of lab grade water
in the bottle labeled “1X Reagent Diluent”.
components.name: Description

source_data.description:
Dilute 2X Reagent Diluent to 1X by adding 30mL of 2X Reagent Diluent to 30mL of lab grade water
in the bottle labeled “1X Reagent Diluent”.

components.data: Preparation of 1X Reagent Diluent
components.name: Section

components.data: Mix well by vortex.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Mix well by vortex.

components.data: Preparation of 1X Reagent Diluent
components.name: Section

components.data:
Reconstitute lyophilized standard with 50μL of lab grade water and mix well by vortex. The
concentration after reconstitution will be 500μg/mL.
components.name: Description

source_data.description:
Reconstitute lyophilized standard with 50μL of lab grade water and mix well by vortex. The
concentration after reconstitution will be 500μg/mL.

components.data:
Continue making 2.5 fold serial dilutions by adding 550μL of the previous dilution to 825μL of 1X
Reagent Diluent in tubes #3-7. Mix well by vortex between each dilution.

 

Note: Tube #8 will be the zero or blank sample and should only contain 1X Reagent Diluent
components.name: Description

source_data.description:
Continue making 2.5 fold serial dilutions by adding 550μL of the previous dilution to 825μL of 1X
Reagent Diluent in tubes #3-7. Mix well by vortex between each dilution.

 

Note: Tube #8 will be the zero or blank sample and should only contain 1X Reagent Diluent

components.data: Preparation of Standard Curve (Refer to Table 2)
components.name: Section

source_data.section: Preparation of Standard Curve (Refer to Table 2)

components.data: Dilute samples in 1X Reagent Diluent. Mix each dilution by vortexing 3 X 2 seconds.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Dilute samples in 1X Reagent Diluent. Mix each dilution by vortexing 3 X 2 seconds.

components.data: Sample Preparation
components.name: Section

components.data:
Run samples in duplicate or triplicate.

 

Note: It is good practice to run at least 2 dilutions for each sample to ensure one of the dilutions falls
within the linear range of the standard curve. We recommend a minimum dilution of 1:10.

 

Note: Dilution factors will vary based on the sample matrix of your experiments. We recommend
running a subset of your samples in the kit to determine optimal dilutions and evaluate any matrix
effects. Failure to do this type of optimization could result in inconclusive data, for which Biolegend is
not responsible.
components.name: Description

source_data.description:

Note: It is good practice to run at least 2 dilutions for each sample to ensure one of the dilutions falls

Note: Dilution factors will vary based on the sample matrix of your experiments. We recommend
running a subset of your samples in the kit to determine optimal dilutions and evaluate any matrix
effects. Failure to do this type of optimization could result in inconclusive data, for which Biolegend is
not responsible.

components.data: Running the Assay - Day 1
components.name: Section

components.data:
Notes: Allow kit components to be brought to room temperature before use.

 

Preparation of Biotinylated Primary Antibody
i. Label a 15mL centrifuge tube as “Biotinylated Primary Antibody”


ii. Dilute the biotinylated primary antibody by adding 6μL* of the Biotinylated Primary
antibody stock to 6mL of 1X Reagent Diluent in the 15mL tube labeled “Biotinylated
Primary Antibody”

 

*Note: A quick spin in a centrifuge is suggested prior to pipetting to ensure liquid is at the bottom of the vessel

.
iii. Mix well by vortex
components.name: Description

source_data.description:
Notes: Allow kit components to be brought to room temperature before use.

 

Preparation of Biotinylated Primary Antibody
i. Label a 15mL centrifuge tube as “Biotinylated Primary Antibody”


ii. Dilute the biotinylated primary antibody by adding 6μL* of the Biotinylated Primary
antibody stock to 6mL of 1X Reagent Diluent in the 15mL tube labeled “Biotinylated
Primary Antibody”

 

*Note: A quick spin in a centrifuge is suggested prior to pipetting to ensure liquid is at the bottom of the vessel

.
iii. Mix well by vortex

components.data:
Make the “HRP Intermediate” by adding 10μL* of Streptavidin-HRP stock to 990μL of 1X
Reagent Diluent in the 1.5mL microcentrifuge tube labeled “HRP Intermediate”.

 

*Note: A quick spin in a centrifuge is suggested prior to pipetting to ensure liquid is at the bottom of the vessel.

*Note: A quick spin in a centrifuge is suggested prior to pipetting to ensure liquid is at the bottom of the vessel.

components.data: Running the Assay - Day 2
components.name: Section

components.data:
Mix chemiluminescent substrates for use:


i. Add 5.5mL of substrate A to a 15mL centrifuge tube.


ii. Add 5.5mL of substrate B to the same 15mL centrifuge tube.


iii. Mix well by vortex.
components.name: Description

source_data.description:
Mix chemiluminescent substrates for use:


i. Add 5.5mL of substrate A to a 15mL centrifuge tube.


ii. Add 5.5mL of substrate B to the same 15mL centrifuge tube.


iii. Mix well by vortex.

components.data: Running the Assay - Day 2
components.name: Section

components.data:
Add 100μL of mixed substrate per well.

 

Note: If reading multiple plates add substrate one plate at a time; do not add substrate to all plates at
the same time. Add substrate to each plate immediately before reading.
components.name: Description

source_data.description:
Add 100μL of mixed substrate per well.

 

Note: If reading multiple plates add substrate one plate at a time; do not add substrate to all plates at
the same time. Add substrate to each plate immediately before reading.

components.data: Running the Assay - Day 2
components.name: Section

components.data:
Shake plate on either a plate shaker or using the shaking mechanism within the platereader for 10-15
seconds.
components.name: Description

source_data.description:
Shake plate on either a plate shaker or using the shaking mechanism within the platereader for 10-15
seconds.

components.data: Running the Assay - Day 2
components.name: Section

components.data:
Read plate immediately.

 

Note: The recommended luminometer settings are to read at a mid-range sensitivity level for 1 second
per well. These settings will vary between plate reader manufacturers, please consult your owner’s
manual prior to performing this assay
components.name: Description

source_data.description:
Read plate immediately.

 

Note: The recommended luminometer settings are to read at a mid-range sensitivity level for 1 second
per well. These settings will vary between plate reader manufacturers, please consult your owner’s
manual prior to performing this assay
